Table 1:Comparison of previous benchmarks andUltraTool. Previous benchmarks focus on limited evaluation dimensions and comprise simple synthesized queries, whileUltraToolconcerns
the entire process of using tools and the queries inUltraToolhave better realism and complexity.
table: ⑥
⑥
⑥
⑥
④⑤
①②③④⑤⑥
references: UltraTool        comprehensively evaluates the tool utilization process including sixdimensions covering three aspects:①         Planning        : decompose the complex goal into logical sequence of simpler sub-tasks. This is essential for effective problem-solving.         Tool Creation        comprises two dimensions:② awareness - assessing whether existing tools suffice, and ③ creation - developing the necessary tools if existing ones are inadequate.         Tool Usage        involves three dimensions:④ awareness - determining which sub-tasks require tools, ⑤ selection - choosing the appropriate tools, and ⑥ usage - specifying the input parameters for these tools.As demonstrated in Table               1             , recent benchmarks in tool utilization tend to focus only on certain dimensions.For examples,               tang2023toolalpaca          ;           xu2023tool          ;           patil2023gorilla          ;           li-etal-2023-api          ;           qin2023toolllm             propose benchmarks for evaluating tool usage (⑥).               huang2023metatool             propose a benchmark to evaluate LLMs’ tool usage awareness (④) and tool selection ability (⑤).Comparing with them, we further evaluate the model capability in planning (①) and tool creation (② and ③), which is crucial for LLMs to adeptly navigate complex and varied user demands.

id_table_2.caption: Table 2:Statistics ofUltraTool.
table: -# of single tool calling
-# of multiple tool callings
avg. steps per sample
avg. tool calls per sample
avg. arguments per tool calling
references: To ensure comprehensive coverage across a variety of domains and to meet the diverse requirements encountered in real-world scenarios, as shown in Table                  2                and Figure                  4                , we carefully selected more than 20 domains such as           Alarms, Trains, Flights, Hotels          , among others.In detail, as depicted in Figure                  3                (a),we collaborated with a wide array of domain-specific experts to gather complex, de-identified user queries that necessitate complex tool usage.To better align each query with its corresponding tool usage, we also requested that the experts suggest several potential tools for each query. These suggestions are formatted in accordance with the style of the ChatGPT plugins                  1                                    1                         1                         https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling                               , which aided in crafting an initial toolset for each query.The detailed guidelines provided to the experts for query collection can be found in the Appendix           LABEL:sec:query_guideline          .

Ultimately, we construct the           UltraTool          , which encompasses 22 domains, 2,032 tools, and 5,824 samples. Detailed statistics of the           UltraTool          are presented in Table                  2                , while Figure                  4                visually depicts the specific domain distribution. All samples within the           UltraTool          involve at least one tool calling. In particular, 5,318 samples comprise multiple tool callings, whereas 506 samples consist of single tool calling. On average, each sample’s plan includes 12.27 steps and 2.72 tool callings                  2                                    2                         2                The existence of ancestral steps and                 tool-free steps                results in a relatively low proportion of                 tool-usage steps                among all steps.                       , with each tool calling requiring an average of 3.05 arguments.
